clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the topical treatment of itching associated with allergic reactions

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Isothipendyl an azaphenothiazine derivative competitively binds to histamine H1 receptors resulting in inhibition of the pharmacological effects of histamines It also has some sedative anticholinergic and antiserotoninergic effects

incompatibilities.description: Isothipendyl may decrease effectiveness of Benzylpenicilloyl polylysine as a diagnostic agent
The therapeutic efficacy of Betahistine can be decreased when used in combination with Isothipendyl
Amphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Phentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Pseudoephedrine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Benzphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Diethylpropion may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Lisdexamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Mephentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
MMDA may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Midomafetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
2 5 Dimethoxy 4 ethylamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
4 Bromo 2 5 dimethoxyamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Tenamfetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Chlorphentermine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Methylenedioxyethamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Dextroamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl

Ritobegron may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl

Methoxyphenamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
Gepefrine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
2 5 Dimethoxy 4 ethylthioamphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Isothipendyl
The therapeutic efficacy of Pitolisant can be decreased when used in combination with Isothipendyl
